text: <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Represses Retroviral Transcription by Targeting Both NF-kappaB and CREB Pathways

Forkhead box ( Fox ) / winged-helix transcription factors regulate multiple aspects of immune responsiveness and <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is recognized as an essential functional marker of regulatory T cells .
Herein we describe downstream signaling pathways targeted by <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> that may negatively impact retroviral pathogenesis .

Overexpression of <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in HEK 293T and purified <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells resulted in a dose - dependent and time - dependent decrease in basal levels of nuclear factor-kappaB ( NF-kappaB ) activation .

Deletion of the carboxyl-terminal forkhead (FKH) domain , critical for nuclear localization and DNA - binding activity , abrogated the ability of <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to suppress NF-kappaB activity in HEK 293T cells , but not in Jurkat or primary human <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells .

text: We further demonstrate that <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> suppressed the transcription of two human retroviral promoters ( HIV-1 and human T cell lymphotropic virus type I [ HTLV-I ] ) utilizing NF-kappaB - dependent and NF-kappaB - independent mechanisms .
Examination of the latter identified the cAMP - responsive element binding protein ( CREB ) pathway as a target of <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Finally , comparison of the percent <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + <extra_id_0> CD25 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells to the HTLV-I proviral load in HTLV-I-infected asymptomatic carriers and patients with HTLV-I - associated myelopathy / tropical spastic paraparesis suggested that high <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression is associated with low proviral load and absence of disease .

text: These results suggest an expanded role for <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in regulating NF-kappaB - and CREB - dependent cellular and viral gene expression .
